item.title: More Tickets Than Ever STILL AVAILABLE for Mickey’s Not So Scary Halloween Party
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Mickey’s Not So Scary Halloween Party officially kicks off in just one week! This special event is one of the best experiences Walt Disney World has to offer. Not surprisingly, that makes it extremely popular. Guests love dressing up in costume (usually against the rules) and trick-or-treating through the Magic Kingdom! Throw in a special ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Mickey’s Not So Scary Halloween Party officially kicks off in just one week! This special event is one of the best experiences Walt Disney World has to offer. Not surprisingly, that makes it extremely popular. Guests love dressing up in costume (usually against the rules) and trick-or-treating through the Magic Kingdom! Throw in a special parade, exciting stage show featuring the Sanderson Sisters and exclusive fireworks show and you can see why guests get very excited about Mickey’s Not So Scary Halloween Party.

Credit: Disney

Last year, the event completely sold out for the very first time in nearly two decades! This year, though, things are looking much slower for the extra-cost event. Tickets have been on sale for months and so far only 6 dates have sold out. That’s unexpected. Even more unexpected, the first night is still available. By this time last year, it was sold out.

The lack of sold out dates is surprising. Disneyland’s Oogie Boogie Bash sold out completely in one day. This is good news for guests going to the event because it means that the event will likely be less crowded than previous years. It also means if you haven’t gotten your tickets yet, you’re in luck– there’s definitely still time.

Credit: Disney

Halloween night is predictably sold out. Opening night is surprisingly still available though! Usually the first night is among the first to sell out. So far 1 night in October (October 31), 1 night in September (September 15), and 4 nights in August (August 15, 18, 22, 25) have sold out. That still leaves 3 nights in August, 12 nights in September, a whooping 17 nights in October and November’s only date (November 1) are all still available.

We don’t predict this event will completely sell out like it did last year. Last year’s popularity was mostly due to pent up demand from COVID and 2020 and 2021’s Mickey’s Not So Scary Halloween Party cancellations. However, if you plan to go, don’t delay in getting your tickets. While we don’t expect the event to be a complete sell out, more dates will certainly become unavailable as we near the Halloween season. Get your tickets here.

item.title: Barefoot Pool Bar at Walt Disney World
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Grab a relaxing cocktail while you lounge by the pool from the Barefoot Pool Bar! Location Credit: Disney Guests will find the Barefoot Pool Bar at Disney’s Polynesian Village Resort. This Walt Disney World Resort pool bar can be found at the Resort’s Lava Pool, located outside of the Resort’s main lobby. Quick Service or ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Grab a relaxing cocktail while you lounge by the pool from the Barefoot Pool Bar!

Location

Credit: Disney

Guests will find the Barefoot Pool Bar at Disney’s Polynesian Village Resort. This Walt Disney World Resort pool bar can be found at the Resort’s Lava Pool, located outside of the Resort’s main lobby.

Quick Service or Table Service?

The Barefoot Pool Bar is a Quick Service dining location. This means that you don’t need any dining reservation to grab a refreshing beverage from this bar. This restaurant offers refreshing drinks as well as several delicious starters and entrees for Guests to enjoy.

Atmosphere

Credit: Disney Dining

This Tiki hut-inspired dining location will transport you from Walt Disney World’s Orlando location to a tropical island oasis. The Barefoot Pool Bar serves tropical drinks for you to enjoy while you lounge poolside and relax at the Polynesian Village Resort.

Menu Options

Credit: orlandoweekly.com

This location offers delicious beverages, starters, and entrees for everyone to enjoy. Delicious starters include the Oasis Salad with Shrimp, the Fried Wonton Chips, and the Black Pepper-Parmesan Chicken Wings. Entrees feature Sashimi of Tuna, Salmon, and Hamachi, the Angus Chuck Cheddar Cheeseburger, the Grilled Sustainable Fish Tacos, and the Grilled Chicken Avocado Wrap.

Specialty non-alcoholic beverages include the Lava Smoothie, Fever-Tree Ginger Beer, and assorted fountain beverages. Signature cocktails include the Frozen Margarita with DOLE Whip Lime, the Pago Pago Painkiller, and The Voyager. For the complete menu, Guests can visit the My Disney Experience app.

Dining Tips

Food menu options are served daily at the Barefoot Pool Bar until 8:00 p.m. If you’re looking for delicious food after 8:00 p.m., use the My Disney Experience app to place a Mobile Order at Capt. Cooks. This Quick Service restaurant is located near the Lava Pool and allows Guests to order ahead using Mobile Order. Once your order is ready, bring your food back to enjoy poolside.

item.title: Johnny Depp’s Emotional Farewell to Jack Sparrow
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Johnny Depp is a legendary character actor and became a household name as the infamous Captain Jack Sparrow. His career has spanned decades and includes an incredibly diverse range of roles from horror to musicals and everything in between! The versatile actor has been Edward Scissorhands, Sweeny Todd, Gellert Grindelwald, The Lone Ranger, Willy Winka, ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Johnny Depp is a legendary character actor and became a household name as the infamous Captain Jack Sparrow. His career has spanned decades and includes an incredibly diverse range of roles from horror to musicals and everything in between! The versatile actor has been Edward Scissorhands, Sweeny Todd, Gellert Grindelwald, The Lone Ranger, Willy Winka, the Mad Hatter…even Donald Trump! Still, when you say Johnny Depp, it is Jack Sparrow that comes to mind.

Credit: Disney, iStock

In addition to one of the main driving forces behind the massive popularity of the Pirates of the Caribbean film franchise, Jack Sparrow is also Depp’s most reprised role. Depp has graced the silver screen as Captain Jack Sparrow five times over the course of two-decades. It’s no wonder that he became as attached to the character as fans were. Two decades after the first film’s release, Jack Sparrow remains one of the most well-developed, well-written anti-heroes in film history.

Playing the iconic character took a toll on Depp. After two decades as Jack Sparrow, he grew to appreciate the character on a very personal level. “It’s very strange. I’m not real spooky about that whole, ‘You become the character,’ that’s not it at all, ” Depp said. “Just, knowing someone so well and having played them, having them be second nature, it just happens naturally. It’s very foreign to the body to stop doing it.”

Credit: Disney

He says that after he wrapped filming for the final time, he fell into a deep depression at the thought of never being Captain Jack Sparrow again. “I really loved being the character so much so that at the end of the film, when they wrapped the end of the film — and this has happened to me before — you go through a sort of a decompression, and a depression where you feel like, ‘God, I’ve just been this other guy for six months or seven months. I’ll never see him again,’” he said.

While Depp was in the throes of depression and coming to terms with Jack Sparrow’s story being over, his ex-wife, Amber Heard, accused him of abuse. What followed was a brutal trail on the court of public opinion. He was presumed guilty and quickly dropped from projects. He and Disney had a tumultuous falling out that left Depp feeling alone and betrayed after Disney severed ties with him just four days after Amber Heard accused him of domestic violence. The defamation trial against Heard that followed was highly publicized and though Depp won, Disney didn’t backtrack on their ousting of the vindicated actor.

Credit: Flickr, Tom Blair

Though rumors swirl that the actor will reprise his role as the iconic pirate, he remains adamant that he will not. He’s even gone so far as to say he’d turn down $20 million for the part. He has grieved the loss of his relationship with Disney and has mourned the end of Captain Jack Sparrow. His parting words as the character are a fitting send off for the beloved captain, “I have a rendezvous beyond my beloved horizon.”

item.title: Crazy Crowds Come Back After Reports of “Ghost Town” Disney World
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: The crowds at Disney World create an enchanting and bustling atmosphere that is both exhilarating and overwhelming. As one of the most popular and iconic theme park destinations in the world, Disney World attracts Guests from all walks of life, creating a diverse and vibrant gathering of people. The sheer volume of visitors can often ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The crowds at Disney World create an enchanting and bustling atmosphere that is both exhilarating and overwhelming. As one of the most popular and iconic theme park destinations in the world, Disney World attracts Guests from all walks of life, creating a diverse and vibrant gathering of people. The sheer volume of visitors can often give the Park a sense of constant motion and excitement, but it also presents some challenges and considerations for those navigating through the sea of people.

Walt Disney World is home to four theme parks, Magic Kingdom, EPCOT, Disney’s Animal Kingdom, and Disney’s Hollywood Studios. Each Disney Park includes magical character meet and greets, thrilling attractions, amazing dining options, and much more. Walt Disney World Resort sees thousands of Guests daily with this amount of traffic heading to Disney Parks, Guests planning their trips tend to look for certain times when Disney is experiencing lower crowds.

Credit: Disney

During peak seasons and holidays, the crowds at Disney World can reach staggering numbers, resulting in long lines, crowded walkways, and packed attractions. The main hubs, such as Cinderella Castle at Magic Kingdom or World Showcase at EPCOT, can become particularly congested as Guests gather to watch parades, fireworks, and entertainment shows. The energy of the crowd is contagious, as the collective enthusiasm of visitors creates an infectious atmosphere of joy and wonder.

Navigating through the crowds requires a combination of patience, strategy, and flexibility. Disney World has implemented various crowd management techniques to help streamline the Guests experience, including advanced reservations for dining and attractions, virtual queues for popular rides, and Genie + system and Lighting Lane that allow Guests to reserve access to select attractions in advance.

Credit: Disney

Despite the challenges posed by large crowds, there is a unique camaraderie that forms among Guests. People from all around the world come together to share in the magic of Disney, bonding over their common love for beloved characters, enchanting stories, and the thrill of experiencing the Park’s attractions. Families, friends, and solo travelers alike can be seen interacting, laughing, and sharing memorable moments throughout Disney Parks.

Credit: Brian McGowan on Unsplash

In a social media post, One Guest commented about the number of people at the Parks. The wait time at Disney Parks can show how many Guests they are seeing. This Guest waited 30 minutes for Remy’s Ratatouille Adventure in the rain. They also waited over an hour for Space Mountain, even during one of the fireworks shows. Another thing this Guest talks about is that TRON Lightcycle/Run sold out first thing in the morning in about three seconds.

“We just got back–we waited an hour and 30 minutes for Remy, in the rain on a Tuesday. Waited an hour and 10 minutes for Space Mountain during the evening fireworks. Tron sold out at 7am in approx 3.5 seconds. The parks are not empty.”

Disney World is a place where Guests can make memories that will last a lifetime. The Wonder of magic comes alive, and Guests can immerse themself in the different Parks. While Disney crowds can be large, the magic is still there and Guests can still have a great experience even at Disney’s busier times.

item.title: Disney Faces Smothering Accusations, Fans Leave In Droves
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Fans across the globe travel to Disney Parks to have a magical time. The same can be said of excited audiences streaming Disney+ or taking the time to go to the movie theater for a new Disney release. What was once a trusted entity in warm, uplifting, quality content has turned into something that fans ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Fans across the globe travel to Disney Parks to have a magical time. The same can be said of excited audiences streaming Disney+ or taking the time to go to the movie theater for a new Disney release. What was once a trusted entity in warm, uplifting, quality content has turned into something that fans can’t seem to escape from. Back to back to back announcements about Disney’s live action remakes of beloved films has fans accusing the company of smothering them.

Credit: Disney

The list of every upcoming live action remake is truly suffocating, with new announcements happening only hours apart. Most recently, fans were notified that both Tangled and The Princess and the Frog were next on the docket. Here’s the current list as of now:

That list doesn’t even include all planned sequels or movies in the pre-development stages. This is also on the heels of The Little Mermaid remake starring Halle Bailey and Haunted Mansion, both of which underperformed in theaters. AND Disney+’s Peter Pan & Wendy! Fans barely have a second to come up for air.

Let us breath I’m beggin pic.twitter.com/5cNbPdq6Ot

— A Starseed Is Born (@CnickB25) August 4, 2023

Disney’s live action remakes must be making some kind of money but retold Disney Princess stories with big names like Emma Watson don’t seem to be what fans are asking for. Does Walt Disney Studios plan to remake its entire catalog of animated films?

Also, how is Disney able to keep releasing these announcements during the entertainment labor strikes that have pretty much shut down Hollywood? Personally, I don’t think artificial intelligence is going to be able to save the Disney remake trend. Fans are already tired of it!

Credit: Disney

Disney’s live action remakes reveal the machinery behind a company that built its brand on empathy, humanity, and wholesomeness. The company willingly smothers its audience for what it thinks is easy money.

Will fans’ alienation translate at the box office? Or can all the social media complaints just be written off?

item.title: New ‘Guardians of the Galaxy’ Content Coming in September!
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Marvel fans mourning the end of the Guardians of the Galaxy film saga can find joy again in Disney Plus’ I Am Groot season two! Referred to as “Marvel’s Sweetest Hero,” Baby Groot takes center stage in this Disney streaming series that premiered in August 2022 and gained immediate fan love. Now, Marvel Studios has ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Marvel fans mourning the end of the Guardians of the Galaxy film saga can find joy again in Disney Plus’ I Am Groot season two! Referred to as “Marvel’s Sweetest Hero,” Baby Groot takes center stage in this Disney streaming series that premiered in August 2022 and gained immediate fan love. Now, Marvel Studios has announced the highly anticipated season two of I Am Groot will premiere on September 6th!

Here are the details…

Credit: Marvel Studios

Just like season one, I Am Groot season two will feature five never before seen animated shorts following Baby Groot’s adventures across the galaxy. In addition to starring “everyone’s favorite little tree,” fans got to meet “several new and unusual characters” throughout the Disney series. Season two of the Kirsten Lepore-created TV series promises the same space escapades but could possibly be even CUTER this time around.

In the official trailer for I Am Groot season two, we see the adorable little guy playing with an action figure and a soup can (which seem to fall in love?), pining over some galactic ice cream ship, fogging up a window in the shape of a heart, and it only gets bigger from there.

Credit: Marvel Studios

Baby Groot presumably continues visiting various planets across the galaxy. Audiences can enjoy watching him in a snowball fight, enjoying some marshmallows, floundering in an Indiana Jones-style adventure, and even learning what it’s like to have a functioning nose.

Taking advantage of all the tree puns, Marvel Entertainment posted, “You woodn’t beleaf what Groot gets up to in Season 2!” Check out the official trailer below!

You woodn’t beleaf what Groot gets up to in Season !

Marvel Studios’ #IAmGroot Season 2 is streaming September 6 on @DisneyPlus. #NationalTreeDay pic.twitter.com/6JZbnGpbgK

— Marvel Entertainment (@Marvel) August 6, 2023

Marvel especially saved this announcement for the first Sunday in August, also known as National Tree Day. So cute.

Will you be tuning in to see Baby Groot in action? It’s definitely a great way to ease your Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 withdrawal.

item.title: SWAT standoff prompted in Carlsbad after possibly armed man barricades himself inside vehicle
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: SAN DIEGO — An hours-long SWAT standoff that caused Friday morning road closures in Carlsbad has ended. A man with armed with a hand gun was reportedly experiencing a mental health crisis inside his vehicle on the 2700 block of Loker Avenue West, near Palomar Airport Road, the Carlsbad Police Department confirmed. Tijuana man accused ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
SAN DIEGO — An hours-long SWAT standoff that caused Friday morning road closures in Carlsbad has ended.

A man with armed with a hand gun was reportedly experiencing a mental health crisis inside his vehicle on the 2700 block of Loker Avenue West, near Palomar Airport Road, the Carlsbad Police Department confirmed.


Tijuana man accused in drug trafficking case extradited to San Diego

The situation initially started around 7:15 p.m. Thursday following reports of an individual in distress in an office building parking lot on Loker Avenue West, according to police.

Authorities say the man activated the vehicle’s emergency communication system — similar to OnStar — Thursday evening.

Carlsbad police told FOX 5 it was challenging to communicate with the man through the third-party OnStar system due to a language barrier.

Police temporarily closed Loker Avenue West from Palomar Airport Road to El Fuerte Street while officers responded to the situation. Crisis negotiators were also called to the scene and police say someone who speaks the man’s language also assisted throughout the standoff.

Businesses on Loker Avenue West from Palomar Airport Road to 2762 Loker Avenue West were also temporarily closed “out of an abundance of caution,” police said.

Those arriving to work in the area where seen being turned away by authorities. It appeared public transportation was also been affected. A BREEZE bus was seen at a standstill around 7 a.m.

Authorities say there no current threat to public and the SWAT standoff “has been resolved peacefully.”

All roads in the area have have since reopened.

FOX 5’s Elizabeth Alvarez contributed to this report.

Suggest a Correction

item.title: Imitation In-N-Out opens in Mexico
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: A new burger restaurant that recently opened in Mexico is making burger enthusiasts do a double-double take since it’s drawing comparisons to U.S.-based In-N-Out Burger restaurants. The Mexico-based restaurant, known as In-I-Nout, serves grilled topped burgers and fries, along with a special sauce, all served on a red tray, just like In-N-Out restaurants in the ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
A new burger restaurant that recently opened in Mexico is making burger enthusiasts do a double-double take since it’s drawing comparisons to U.S.-based In-N-Out Burger restaurants.

The Mexico-based restaurant, known as In-I-Nout, serves grilled topped burgers and fries, along with a special sauce, all served on a red tray, just like In-N-Out restaurants in the U.S.


In-N-Out Burger employees barred from wearing masks

A video of the restaurant made its rounds on TikTok in early July and has garnered about 1 million views and more than 53,000 likes.

However, In-N-Out doesn’t seem too happy with the surprise pop-up restaurant, telling KTLA that they are unable to comment “due to ongoing litigation,” signaling that the restaurant is pursuing legal action against the copycat.

In-N-Out Burger opened in 1948 as a tiny stand at Francisquito and Garvey avenues in Baldwin Park. Harry and Esther Snyder, the company’s founders, are credited with inventing the world’s first drive-thru with a two-way speaker box that same year.


The not-so-secret meaning behind In-N-Out’s palm trees

For years, the restaurants could only be found in the Los Angeles area, but company officials slowly began expanding its footprint in other regions across the state and nearby states.

As of 2023, the company has 385 locations across the western half of the nation. In January, the company announced that it would open restaurants and a corporate office in Tennessee by 2026.

Suggest a Correction

item.title: Barbie Dreamhouse pop-up truck making stop in San Diego at Westfield UTC
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: SAN DIEGO — Attention Barbie fans: a new Dreamhouse-themed pop-up is headed to San Diego next week. The Barbie Truck Dreamhouse Living Tour is set to roll into America’s Finest City in hot-pink style, with a stop at Westfield UTC on Saturday, Aug. 12. The Barbie Truck Tour set back on the road earlier this ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
SAN DIEGO — Attention Barbie fans: a new Dreamhouse-themed pop-up is headed to San Diego next week.

The Barbie Truck Dreamhouse Living Tour is set to roll into America’s Finest City in hot-pink style, with a stop at Westfield UTC on Saturday, Aug. 12.

The Barbie Truck Tour set back on the road earlier this year with an all-new look to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the doll’s moving into her original Dreamhouse, a cardboard ranch-style house reminiscent of a 1962 college student’s pad.

This year’s Dreamhouse Living Tour is channeling the flower power of the decade, along with the quintessential hyper-pink Malibu aesthetic that has become synonymous with the Barbie brand.


‘Barbie-mania’ in San Diego: Check out these activities to join the hot pink craze

When the truck arrives in San Diego next week, fans will be able to snag an array of exclusive apparel, home goods and accessories inspired by a day in the life of Barbie while hanging out in her Dreamhouse.

Collectibles available with the colorful truck include everything from graphic tees and hoodies to throw blankets and coasters.

Merchandise prices at the truck range from $12 to $75, according to organizers. Purchases over $40 will include a free gift.

Multiple totally Barbie photo opportunities will also be available in front of the colorful backdrop of the truck.

The original Barbie Truck Totally Throwback Tour kicked off in Los Angeles in 2019, followed by the Barbie Malibu Truck Tour in 2021. The Barbie Truck Dreamhouse Living tour will continue to travel to different cities throughout the U.S. for the remainder of the year.

For the San Diego stop, the truck will be parked between the stores Pirch and Room & Board. Following San Diego, the Dreamhouse Living Tour will continue its route through the southwest with a stop in Las Vegas on Aug. 19.

Suggest a Correction

item.title: man injured after driver makes U-turn
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: SAN DIEGO — A motorcyclist was injured Friday night after colliding with a vehicle in the Ridgeview/Webster neighborhood, authorities said. According to the San Diego Police Department, collision occurred in the 4500 block of Home Ave. around 10:18 p.m. Authorities say a 46-year-old woman was stopped in the bike lane facing east along the south ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
SAN DIEGO — A motorcyclist was injured Friday night after colliding with a vehicle in the Ridgeview/Webster neighborhood, authorities said.

According to the San Diego Police Department, collision occurred in the 4500 block of Home Ave. around 10:18 p.m.

Authorities say a 46-year-old woman was stopped in the bike lane facing east along the south curb in a 2011 Hyundai Tucson. At that same time, a 25-year-old man was traveling eastbound while riding a 2017 Yamaha motorcycle.


Hours-long SWAT standoff ends in Carlsbad

The Hyundai reportedly made a U-turn from the bike lane directly into the path of the motorcycle, according to SDPD. The motorcyclist struck the Hyundai on the driver’s side front fender as a result.

Police say the rider was transported to the hospital with multiple fractures and a laceration to his ankle. His injuries are considered non-life threatening.

SDPD says DUI was not a factor in this collision. The department’s Traffic Division is investigating.

Anyone with information related to the incident is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 888-580-8477.

Suggest a Correction
